channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: DOF sees jump in cybercrime under new normal
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: As more Filipinos resort to online transactions amid the pandemic, the Department of Finance said yesterday it expects an increase in illegal activities on the internet.

item.title: PCOO assists DepEd on blended learning materials
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The Presidential Communications Operations Office has offered to produce the learning videos for blended learning which will be implemented by the Department of Education as part of adjusting to the situation under the coronavirus disease 2019 or COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: CHR: Attacks vs rights defenders systematic
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: A special inquiry conducted by the Commission on Human Rights last year has found systematic attacks against human rights defenders in the country.

item.title: Duterte declares 2020 Year of Filipino Health Workers
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: With the world hit by the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, President Duterte has declared 2020 as the “Year of Filipino Health Workers” to recognize the “invaluable contribution” of Filipino doctors, nurses and medical workers here and abroad in dealing with COVID-19.

item.title: Over 12,000 Covid test samples are backlogs — DOH
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: A total of 12,208 samples are now considered “backlogs” because the processing in various laboratories has been delayed, the Department of Health said yesterday.

item.title: IATF to intensify contact tracing at entry ports
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: With almost 10,000 new cases reported in the past week, the government is intensifying its surveillance and contact tracing efforts as well as swabbing – via polymerase chain reaction testing – for coronavirus disease 2019 at all ports of entry.

item.title: DILG allays fears over motorcycle barrier for couples
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government has tried to allay safety concerns over the proposal to install plastic barriers or shields to allow back-riding for couples on motorcycles.

item.title: Meralco cuts July rates
item.author: Danessa Rivera
item.description: The Manila Electric Co. has announced lower rates for the third straight month in July, as it continued to invoke the force majeure provision in its power supply agreements or PSA.

item.title: Go bills to combat child sexual abuse
item.description: Sen. Bong Go filed a measure to amend Republic Act No. 7610 or the “Special Protection of Children Against Abuse, Exploitation and Discrimination Act” which will enhance the country’s protective measures against child sexual abuse.
